title: President Trump's Speech About Money and Immigrants
summary: President Trump went to Pennsylvania to talk about how expensive things are for people, which is called affordability. But during his long speech, he spent a lot of time saying bad things about immigrants. This made some people upset because he was supposed to focus on money problems. Two experts, one from the Democratic party and one from the Republican party, shared their thoughts on what Trump said. They had different opinions about his speech. This shows how politicians sometimes change what they talk about when they are campaigning.

background_read: Context: President Trump is a politician who gives speeches to talk about issues. Affordability means how much things like food and houses cost. Immigrants are people who come to live in a new country. Sometimes, politicians change topics to appeal to voters during campaigns.
Article_Structure: WHAT: Gave a speech about affordability but focused on immigrants
WHY: To address money problems but ended up talking about immigration during campaigning

perspectives.description: Ameshia Cross, a Democratic strategist, likely criticized Trump for shifting focus away from affordability to attack immigrants.
Tiffany Smiley, a Republican former candidate, might have defended or explained Trump's speech as part of political strategy.
